intro: Phanerophlebia hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's phanerophlebia, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves that are often finely divided and arranged in a feathery pattern. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions with cool, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
